intro: Boechera drepanoloba, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its small, white or pinkish flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a compact growth habit and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
